alert.note: Alert for City of Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 8:35PM EDT until August 10 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent city, City of Suffolk. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding near the 2600 block of Desert Road. Flooding is already occurring. The heaviest rain has ended. Therefore, the Flash Flood Warning has been replaced with a Flood Warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Suffolk, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Saunders, Nurney, Suffolk Airport and Kilby. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
